image.altText: A blue hospital building.

props.synopsis: Monash Health in Melbourne's south-east has discovered black mould in an area where cancer patients are treated.

title.children: Major Melbourne hospital discovers black mould in cancer treatment area

image.altText: A woman sits in a paddock.

props.synopsis: Called The Electric Eight, these Warrnambool mums are speaking out via a podcast about their experiences of losing a baby in the hope that other regional women and families can find better support.

title.children: The Electric Eight want to help you talk about losing a baby

image.altText: A middle-aged man and woman stand outside in front of several solar panels, smiling at the camera

props.synopsis: Victorian government regulations limit the sharing of generated power between properties, even if they have the same owner. Farmers are calling for changes so they can capitalise on their own microgrids.

title.children: Farmers call for ease of regulations to allow renewable energy microgrids

image.altText: a portrait photograph of Kevin Bell wearing a suit in studio lighting

props.synopsis: A former Yoorrook justice commissioner and Victorian Aboriginal community leaders are urging the state government to make good on the "genuine promise" it made by setting up Australia's first Aboriginal-led truth-telling inquiry.

title.children: 'Urgent beyond words': Former Yoorrook commissioner speaks out since findings

image.altText: A police car and police tape seen blocking the scene of a residential street in Wollert, where a shooting took place

props.synopsis: Police are investigating a suspected targeted shooting after the discovery of a 21-year-old's body in Wollert. Separately, detectives have charged five men with murder over a fatal shooting almost two years ago.

title.children: Gunman at large after 21-year-old found dead in Melbourne's north

image.altText: A woman smiles and poses for a photo that has been overlayed with a sepia filter, adjusting the colour to give it a yellow tone

props.synopsis: A coroner finds no clear cause of death for 53-year-old Rachael Dixon, who died at a wellness retreat in regional Victoria.

title.children: Coroner finds woman died 'in the context' of taking magic mushrooms

image.altText: The Coroners Court of Victoria sign in front of the Australian, Aboriginal, and Torres Strait Islander flags.

props.synopsis: A midwife says "extreme tiredness" could have impaired her decision-making during a tragic home birth in Victoria.

title.children: Midwives tell inquest of 'regrets' from home birth and baby's death

image.altText: Rebels bikies ride their motorcycles along Scarborough Beach Road.

props.synopsis: Specialist police prepare for a Rebels Motorcycle Club run to Melbourne this weekend, before tougher laws banning the display of club colours and insignia come into force.

title.children: Rebels to ride through Victoria in last hurrah before gang colours ban

image.altText: A police car at night

props.synopsis: A man shot dead by police in regional Victoria was attacking his sister when officers arrived, authorities say.

title.children: Man shot dead by police was attacking his sister, authorities say

image.altText: An image of an unidentifiable police officer whos head can't be seen, with their hands on their hips wearing a high vis vest.

props.synopsis: A Federal Court judge has thrown out a case brought by Victoria's police union that alleged frontline members were owed hundreds of millions of dollars in unpaid overtime.

title.children: Federal Court throws out police union's unpaid overtime claim

image.altText: A man wearing a chequered shirt and helmet sitting on a motorbike looking at the camera.

props.synopsis: The mother of teenage man, who died after he was hit by a car, says the bond she shared with her son was the most incredible thing she had in her entire life.

title.children: Friends, family pay tribute to beloved teen killed in crash

image.altText: A man pictured smiling at the altar on his wedding day.

props.synopsis: Father of two Brian Dean died of sepsis about 24 hours after he was discharged from a Geelong hospital. His family and their lawyer want a coroner to examine whether the death was preventable.

title.children: Brian was discharged from hospital. He died from sepsis the next day

image.altText: A red and white majestic Victorian mansion with a turret, blue sky with clouds.

props.synopsis: Local government elected officials in Victoria say they are being threatened, abused and harassed online and in person, but they have no protection.

title.children: Councillors call for help as threats, abuse leave them living in fear

image.altText: Police escort a man in a hoodie towards a car.

props.synopsis: New South Wales Police say they also seized cash and items alleged to be the proceeds of crime.

title.children: Men to face court after seizure of $1m worth of cocaine

image.altText: A fire truck and firefighters.

props.synopsis: A man has been arrested for his alleged role in the December 2024 arson of the Adass Israel Synagogue of Melbourne in the city's inner south-east.

title.children: Overseas links probed in Melbourne synagogue arson attack as man arrested

image.altText: A house on a rural block.

props.synopsis: Convicted triple-murderer Erin Patterson has been barred from selling the home in which she served her relatives a deadly beef Wellington meal so it may be used in future compensation claims by her victims or their families.

title.children: Mushroom murderer Erin Patterson barred from selling Leongatha home

image.altText: A brick wool factory with several angled iron roof gables

props.synopsis: Victoria's last wool cleaning mill will close in Geelong next month, after a merger with the only other remaining wool scour in the country.

title.children: Wool scouring to end in Victoria after more than 160 years

image.altText: Steak, chops and pork on display in butcher's window

props.synopsis: The National Party wants an inquiry into the decision to lift biosecurity controls on US beef imports, claiming the federal government ignored its own scientific advice.

title.children: Nationals push for Senate inquiry into decision to resume US beef imports

image.altText: A man tying his shoe laces next to a man in a hat.

props.synopsis: After 45 years, the Australians who competed in the 1980 Moscow Olympics will be recognised for their contribution after defying government opposition and copping public backlash.

title.children: After four decades, Australia acknowledges 1980 Moscow Olympians

image.altText: Woman leans on farm gate, man holds small child, white ute and paddock in the background.

props.synopsis: Victorian farmers are vowing to block access to transmission line builders, even if it leads to large fines and clashes with police.

title.children: Farmers vow to block access to transmission projects despite legal risks

image.altText: A CFA worker in front of a truck rollover

props.synopsis: The Hume Freeway has been reopened southbound following a fatal collision north-east of Seymour.

title.children: Hume Freeway reopened north of Seymour following fatal accident

image.altText: Burnt out car outside a Mentone car repair shop

props.synopsis: A number of car fires have been set alight at automotive repair businesses in Melbourne's south-east and west.

title.children: Cars set alight at Melbourne repair centres

image.altText: Looking up at the pillars outside the Victorian Parliament.

props.synopsis: The Victorian government will move to make it even harder for repeat offenders to get bail when parliament resumes today, while the opposition and Greens will scrutinise scandals in the childcare sector.

title.children: Education department to be probed in Greens' parliamentary inquiry into childcare

image.altText: SES and police vehicles beside a road.

props.synopsis: A crime scene has been established at the site where part of a skull was found along the Murray River at Mildura.

title.children: Walker finds partial skull on riverbank near Mildura holiday park

image.altText: Two women, one in indigenous head dress and cloak, smile at the camera.

props.synopsis: Traditional owners in Victoria's north-west are the first in the state to be granted exclusive native title rights. But what does that mean and how will it work?

title.children: The strongest form of native title is now in Victoria. Here’s how it works

image.altText: Lili Greer as a child hugging her mum Tina

props.synopsis: While Lili says her experience with violence and loss will have lifelong impacts, advocating for change has been part of her healing.

title.children: Lili's mum was murdered by her boyfriend. She is advocating for change

image.altText: Rainbow over cropping farm at Walpeup, Victoria.

props.synopsis: Welcome rain has brought smiles to farmers' faces and boosted water storages in Victoria.

title.children: Victorian farmer says calves 'aren't used to' influx of rain

image.altText: Ellie Blackburn speaks while standing near a football and the AFLW premiership cup

props.synopsis: Ahead of its 10th season, amid stagnating crowds and ratings, AFL chief executive Andrew Dillon says the AFLW remains an investment "absolutely worth making".

title.children: AFLW remains 'investment worth making' despite concerns, Dillon says

image.altText: A close-up of a cheetah's face. It's tongue reaching it's nose.

props.synopsis:
Kulinda the Cheetah just turned 12 years old and is enjoying her retirement in Melbourne's Werribee Open Range Zoo.

Cheetahs are known to live up to eight years in the wild.

title.children: Senior cheetah Kulinda enjoys her golden years

image.altText: An excavator sits atop a pile of woodchips.

props.synopsis: A former golf course in inner-Melbourne is being transformed into what the council describes as a biodiversity refuge of wetlands and wildflower meadows, but residents fear the removal of native trees is undermining the project's aims.

title.children: 'Ham-fisted' tree removal sparks concerns as golf course transformed

image.altText: The Coroners Court of Victoria exterior in daylight.

props.synopsis: The mother of a baby boy who died after a planned home birth tells an inquest she assumed she would be transferred to hospital when complications first arose, but a midwife chose to monitor her "more closely".

title.children: Mother recalls 'what if' moment during home birth at baby death inquest

image.altText: A girl in her 20s with green eyes looks straight at the camera wearings timber Aboriginal designed earrings

props.synopsis: With more than 600 Indigenous deaths in custody since the royal commission, First Nations families say the staggering toll is Australia's shame.

title.children: Six hundred deaths, little justice: The ongoing toll of deaths in custody

image.altText: A middle-aged man wearing navy blue police uniform looks on sideways

props.synopsis: Victoria does not need a permit system for protests, says the state's new top cop, who concedes there has been a breakdown in public confidence in police.

title.children: Weeks into the job, Victoria's new police chief admits there is 'too much crime'

image.altText: Damage along the front left of an aircraft named Virgin Australia

props.synopsis: A Virgin Australia plane becomes disconnected from a tug vehicle and collides into it at Tullamarine airport.

title.children: Virgin plane collides with tug vehicle at Melbourne Airport

image.altText: A sign saying "Wyndham City Civic Centre", with bicycles in front of it.

props.synopsis: A council in Melbourne's booming outer south-west has been referred to the state's anti-corruption watchdog over a failed IT project worth tens of millions of dollars.

title.children: Wyndham council referred to anti-corruption watchdog over IT bungle
